services

Class SQLServiceDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • services.SQLServiceDB
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IServiceDB

    public class SQLServiceDB
extends java.lang.Object
implements IServiceDB
    A class for SQL storage of services in a database. The id of the service is taken to be its primary key.
    Author:
    Macky Dieng, Baptiste Vannesson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.sql.Connection link
      A link to the database.
      protected java.lang.String table
      The name for the SQL table where to store services.

      • SQLServiceDB

        public SQLServiceDB(java.sql.Connection link,
                    java.lang.String table)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Builds a new instance.
        Parameters:
        link - An active connection to an SQL database
        table - The name of the table where to store Services
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • Method Detail

      • setLink

        public void setLink(java.sql.Connection link)
        Resets the link to the database. This method can be used in case the connection breaks down.
        Parameters:
        link - An active link to the database

      • createTables

        public void createTables()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates the necessary table in the database. Nothing occurs if the table already exists.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      • create

        public int create(Service service)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Stores a new service in the database.
        Specified by:
        create in interface IServiceDB
        Parameters:
        service - The service to store
        Returns:
        The last inserted id
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      • retrieve

        public Service retrieve(int id)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves a service in the database.
        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface IServiceDB
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the service
        Returns:
        A service, or null if none with the given name exists in the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      • retrieveAll

        public java.util.List<Service> retrieveAll()
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves all services in the database.
        Returns:
        A list of all services in the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      • retrieveAll

        public java.util.List<Service> retrieveAll(java.lang.String status)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves all services in the database, given a certain status.
        Parameters:
        status - The status
        Returns:
        All services that have the given status
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      • exists

        public boolean exists(int id)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if a service exists in the database.
        Specified by:
        exists in interface IServiceDB
        Parameters:
        id - The service's id
        Returns:
        True or false
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

        public void update(Service service,
                   int id)
            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Stores a new service in the database.
        Specified by:
        update in interface IServiceDB
        Parameters:

        id - The id of the service to update
        Throws:

      • deleteTables

        public void deleteTables()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the table from the database. Nothing occurs if the table does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      • delete

        public void delete(int id)
            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes a service. Nothing occurs in case the service does not exist in the database.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface IServiceDB
        Parameters:
        Service - The service
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs
